resources.string: We\'ll let you know if you\'ve come into contact with anyone, who has reported symptoms on their app.
You have reported symptoms within the past 14 days. Please self-isolate until the 14 days is over, to help save lives.

The app will remember everyone who you\'ve come into contact with (so long as they have the app). You can safely use other apps whilst this is running. \n \nYou may hear an occasional sound in the background - this is the app using ultrasound to detect nearby phones.

Covid Tracker keeps a list of everyone you\’ve come into contact with (less than 2m away), where they also have the app. Then, if one of these people reports symptoms, you’ll also be alerted to self-quarantine so that we can slow the spread together. 
 
Everything is anonymous, and no personal data (like your name) or GPS location data is ever recorded. Users will never be told where, when or by whom they have been infected. 
 
Technically speaking, the app uses Bluetooth, Wifi and near-ultrasound audio for precise proximity detection. You may hear a very quiet sound every minute for 10 seconds - this is the near-ultrasound audio and we're working to make this even quieter.
Do you have a high temperature?
This means you feel hot to touch on your chest or back (you do not need to measure your temperature).
Do you have a new, continuous cough?
This means coughing a lot for more than an hour, or 3 or more coughing episodes in 24 hours (if you usually have a cough, it may be worse than usual).
You are not showing the common symptoms of Coronavirus

You may still be infected.

 Many people won't show symptoms for around 5 days, and others won't show symptoms at all. 

 If you think you may have been infected, we still recommend that you self-quarantine to be safe.
